title: Python: Personal Budget Tracker (CLI)
summary: A command-line tool to record expenses, categorise spending, and export data for review.
situation: Managing daily expenses without structure makes it difficult to track spending patterns.
task: Create a simple, reliable tool to record expenses quickly and store them in a reusable format.
action: Designed a menu-driven CLI for fast data entry
Implemented input validation to prevent incorrect data
Stored records in CSV format for easy analysis later
result: The tool allows consistent expense tracking and produces clean data that can be analysed or visualised later.
learnings: How to structure a Python program using small, reusable functions
Why validating user input is critical even in simple programs
How CSV files can act as a lightweight data storage format

title: Java: Student Grade Calculator
summary: A console application that calculates grades from marks using clear validation and control flow.
situation: Manual grade calculation can be inconsistent and error-prone.
task: Build a Java program that reliably converts marks into grade categories.
action: Used loops and conditionals to process multiple inputs
Applied input validation to handle incorrect values
Structured logic into clear, readable methods
result: The program produces consistent results and can be extended for multiple students.
learnings: How Java control flow differs from Python
Why method structure improves readability and maintenance
How to think in terms of logic flow before writing code

title: Automation: Downloads Folder File Organiser
summary: A Python automation script that organises files by type with safety checks.
situation: Downloads folders quickly become cluttered and hard to manage.
task: Automate file organisation while avoiding accidental data loss.
action: Scanned files using pathlib and OS utilities
Implemented a dry-run mode before moving files
Added logging for traceability and debugging
result: The script keeps folders organised safely and can be reused or extended easily.
learnings: How automation scripts can save time in everyday workflows
Why safety checks are important when working with file systems
How logging helps debug and trust automation code
